subject: Re: [junit] Using junit how do i test java.nio.Buffer injdk1.4
msgSnippet: manckam: The JUnit distribution comes with sample tests in the junit/samples directory. You should work with those to answer your basic questions about
messageBody:
manckam:

The JUnit distribution comes with sample tests in the "junit/samples"
directory. You should work with those to answer your basic questions about
getting started with JUnit. Especially look at the VectorTest.java file which
shows how to test java's Vector class.


HTH

Frank

On Tuesday 08 April 2003 02:38 am, manicks2003 wrote:
> Hai,
>
> Iam supposed to test java.nio.Buffer which is in jdk1.4. The
> problem is that, i do not know how to proceed with writing a test
> case. can anyone help me with a sample coding of how to test
> java.nio.Buffer.
>
> regards,
> manickam.
>
